alert.note: Alert for South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 2:19AM EDT until September 12 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following areas, in Big Bend Florida, Coastal Bay, Coastal Dixie, Coastal Franklin, Coastal Jefferson, Coastal Taylor, Coastal Wakulla, Gadsden, Inland Dixie, Inland Franklin, Inland Jefferson, Inland Taylor, Inland Wakulla, Lafayette, Leon, Liberty and Madison. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Gulf, Inland Bay, Inland Gulf, South Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent heavy rains have led to saturated soils, especially across the watch area along the coast. In these locations, widespread rainfall amounts have been around 4 to 6 inches over the last 48 hours, but isolated locations have seen two day totals nearing 7 to 8 inches. While many inland locations across the watch area have no received flooding rains over the last several days, the potential remains for isolated areas of 2 to 4 inch rainfall amounts in training storms, and along the coastline, additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches can`t be ruled out in isolated areas. While widespread rain totals through today will only be around 2 to 3 inches, it`s there localized higher rainfall totals which could drive new flooding, especially if they fall across regions of already saturated ground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
